item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 1, 2025 at 11:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Happy New Year 2025 (813 points | 190 comments)
2. Static search trees: faster than binary search (369 points | 106 comments)
3. An Unreasonable Amount of Time (147 points | 16 comments)
4. Arnis: Generate cities in Minecraft from OpenStreetMap (336 points | 52 comments)
5. Books I Loved Reading in 2024 (21 points | 1 comment)
6. Nvidia bets on robotics to drive future growth (87 points | 55 comments)
7. C "clockwise/spiral" rule to understand declarations (20 points | 26 comments)
8. The GTA III port for the Dreamcast has been released (351 points | 102 comments)
9. Cesium for Unreal – Bring the Real World to Unreal Engine (43 points | discuss)
10. Déjà vu: Ghostly CVEs in my terminal title (112 points | 26 comments)
11. I Reversed a Drone and Landed It with My PC (110 points | 22 comments)
12. Large Concept Models: Language modeling in a sentence representation space (82 points | 18 comments)
13. FBI: Largest homemade explosives cache in agency history found in Virginia (103 points | 107 comments)
14. Things we learned about LLMs in 2024 (681 points | 454 comments)
15. Celestial Phenomena in 16th-Century Germany (16 points | 1 comment)
16. Lucy: A concise language for describing Finite State Machines (45 points | 4 comments)
17. Building Game Prototypes with LÖVE (140 points | 54 comments)
18. After a 24-second test of its engines, the New Glenn rocket is ready to fly (55 points | 66 comments)
19. Deepseek: The quiet giant leading China’s AI race (387 points | 340 comments)
20. Systems ideas that sound good but almost never work (340 points | 200 comments)
21. I got promoted to staff engineer twice (71 points | 55 comments)
22. Hitting the Jackpot: The Birth of the Monte Carlo Method – LANL (11 points | discuss)
23. Bench.co acquired after informing staff company was insolvent (56 points | 30 comments)
24. Hallucination of closed repeat proteins containing central pockets (2023) (4 points | discuss)
25. Debugging memory corruption: who the hell writes "2" into my stack? (2016) (345 points | 157 comments)
26. I keep turning my Google Sheets into phone-friendly webapps (634 points | 209 comments)
27. More telcos confirm Salt Typhoon breaches as White House weighs in (388 points | 315 comments)
28. Penrose Mazes (2020) (82 points | 10 comments)
29. 3D-printed neighborhood nears completion in Texas (38 points | 49 comments)
30. Revisiting the NetBSD Build System (105 points | 13 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 1, 2025 at 11:10 AM UTC
